titles.title: Waco Independent Investigation Act of 1999
To provide for the appointment of an independent counsel to investigate if there were violations of Federal law in the raid on the Branch Davidian compound in Waco, Texas.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Commercial and Administrative Law.

term.name: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

bill.summary: 9/13/1999--Introduced. Waco Independent Investigation Act of 1999 - Directs the Attorney General to appoint an independent counsel, without regard for the preliminary investigation requirement, to undertake a comprehensive investigation of Federal agency actions in the raid on the Branch Davidian Compound in Waco, Texas, on April 19, 1993, to determine if Federal laws, including civil rights and posse comitatus laws, were violated.
